intro: Petaloma domingense, commonly known as the Dominican petaloma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
